ALLEGATION:
Staff member at facility hit youth with open hand.
INVESTIGATION:
This complaint was received on 01/12/21 and was assigned for investigation by the
DHHS Specialist as well. The complaint noted the following:
Youth A (15) is at Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home. Staff 1 is staff at the
facility. Staff 1 hit Youth A with an open hand.
I conducted an unannounced onsite visit on 01/13/21 jointly with the DHHS
Specialist. We interviewed the Deputy Director (DD) who provided us with the
supporting documentation. The DD provided a verbal review of the incident, noting
that Youth A, Staff 1, Staff 2, and Youth B were playing cards. Youth A looked at
Staff 1’s cards and Staff 1 “swatted” Youth A’s face away with the back of his hand.
The DD said they all continued playing cards for several more minutes. When in the
dining room later on, another youth mentioned that he heard Youth A got “popped”
by Staff 1. This is when Youth A asked to speak to a supervisor and reported that
Staff 1 “smacked the shit out of me.” The DD said that the Chief Administrator was
notified, and the administration reviewed video of the incident and gathered written
statements from the involved parties. The DD reported that this incident occurred on
01/05/21. The DD said that Staff 1 was removed from working with Youth A until the
investigation is done. The DD said that they did not initially feel that this was abuse
and were conducting their investigation with the Union involved so Staff 1 was not
provided the formal allegations until 01/12/21. This was also when the report to
3

Centralized Intake was made. The DD stated that the facility does not allow physical
discipline.
I reviewed the video for this incident. Two camera views were provided. Camera
view 1 is captured from behind Youth A, who was seen seated across a square table
from Youth B. Staff 1 was seated to the left of Youth A and across from Staff 2. The
four were playing cards. About 10:27:27, Youth A was seen leaning to his left and
appeared to be trying to look at Staff 1’s cards. Staff 1 looked at Youth A and
smacked Youth A in the face with the back of his hand. This did not appear to be a
hard smack. Youth A leaned back in his chair while Staff 1 was seen talking. Youth
B got up and walked around laughing. Youth B sat back down at the table and the
four continued playing cards for several minutes.
Camera view 2 was captured facing Youth A. The same activities were viewed as
the participants played cards at the table. About 10:27:27, Youth A looked at Staff
1’s cards. Staff 1 looked at Youth A and smacked him in the lower jaw on Youth A’s
right side, with the back of his hand. This was not observed to be a hard smack. The
events were consistent with Camera view 1.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility, on 01/13/21, jointly with the DHHS Specialist.
Youth A reported that he has been at the facility for about one month and does not
like being there. Youth A reviewed this incident and reported that he was playing
cards and looked over at Staff 1’s cards. Youth A said that Staff 1 told him not to
look at anyone’s “motherfucking hand” and then said that Staff 1 “slapped me.”
Youth A said that he sat there for a minute and about 20 minutes later, he told a
supervisor. Youth A demonstrated how Staff 1 hit him with the back of Staff 1’s
hand, and pointed to his lower jaw/cheek area. Youth A said that Staff 1 hit him hard
and that it hurt. Youth A said he was shocked and did not know why Staff 1 did it.
Youth A said that he played it off until a supervisor came around. Youth A said that
nothing like that had happened to him here before this. Youth A said that he has
seen Staff 1 but has not worked with him since the incident. Youth A said he did not
have any marks or injuries from the incident. Youth A said that he does not feel safe
in the facility since this occurred and he thinks he is going to be moved to another
POD due to reporting this incident.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility, on 01/13/21, jointly with the DHHS Specialist.
Youth B reported that he was playing cards when Youth A looked at Staff 1’s cards.
Youth B said Staff 1 put an arm out like “get back.” Youth B said that he did not
know if Staff 1 said anything to Youth A. The group went to lunch after this incident.
Youth B said that he did not know if they were mad at each other afterward. Youth B
stated that no staff have put their hands on him while in this facility.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility, on 01/13/21, jointly with the DHHS Specialist.
Staff 2 said that there was not much to this incident. Staff 2 recounted playing cards
when Youth A peaked at Staff 1’s cards a couple of times. Staff 2 said that “out of
the blue Staff 1 swatted at Youth A” and contacted Youth A’s neck. This was noted
4

to have been with the back of Staff A’s hand. Staff 2 said that Youth A laughed about
it and they finished the game. Staff 2 said that he thinks Youth A was embarrassed
because the other kids started joking about it. Staff 2 has not seen Staff 1 be
aggressive with any kids and works with Staff 1 daily. Staff 2 said that he heard Staff
1 say something like “why are you looking at my hand.” Staff 2 said that Youth A has
not and will not receive any consequences for reporting this as the staff do not take
this stuff personally.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility, on 01/13/21, jointly with the DHHS Specialist.
Staff 1 recalled the incident and said he was playing cards with Youth A, Youth B
and Staff 2, when he saw Youth A out of the corner of his eye. Staff 1 said that
Youth A being close to him startled him and Staff 1 threw his arm/hand out and said,
“What are you doing? Why are you so close?” Staff 1 said that the back of his hand
contacted the right side, clavicle/neck area on Youth A. Staff 1 said that they
continued the card game and from his assessment, it was not serious. Staff 1 said
that he thought Youth A was stunned too. Staff 1 said that Youth A was not hurt, or
he would have called a nurse. Staff 1 denied hitting Youth A hard and said that he
did not see any marks on Youth A and Youth A did not make any report of being
hurt. Staff 1 denied having contact with Youth A since this incident. Staff 1 said that
this was a “definite accident” and that he has a “great relationship” with all of the
kids. Staff 1 denied that Youth A was given or would receive consequences for
reporting. Staff 1 denied that Youth A would have to change PODS due to this. Staff
1 stated that another youth was kind of teasing Youth A about it and he told that
youth to stop immediately because they do not allow the kids to tease each other.
I interviewed the Chief Administrator (CA) via phone on 01/27/21 regarding this
investigation. The CA provided additional detail regarding the process of events and
explained that when the video of the incident was reviewed on 01/05/21, the facility
did not feel that Staff 1’s action was “abuse” under the child protection law, but
rather “horseplay”. The CA did not feel that it needed to be reported. The CA stated
that when he received and reviewed the written statements on 01/12/21 he read that
Youth A said Staff 1 swore at him when he hit him. The CA said that he assessed
the situation then needed to be called in to Centralized Intake as Staff 1 could have
taken this action out of anger, which then needed to be assessed by a DHHS
Specialist. It was at this time, and because of the additional information, that the
facility made to report to Centralized Intake.
I interviewed Youth A’s Probation Officer (PO) via phone, on 02/01/21, jointly with
the DHHS Specialist. The PO reported no concerns regarding safety at the facility.
The PO had been advised of this incident by the facility.
I interviewed the complainant via phone on 02/16/21. The complainant reported that
his report and written statement are accurate to what he knew about the incident.
Documentation reviewed for this investigation includes the following, with applicable
information noted:
5

 Incident Report, dated 01/05/21, authored by Staff 1. The report was
consistent with Staff 1’s interview.
 Initial written statement from Youth A, dated 01/06/21. Youth A wrote that he
was playing cards and looked at Staff 1’s hand. Youth A wrote that, ‘I look
again and he slap me and face and said you don’t look at my mother fucking
hand…’ ‘…like 20 minutes later it was make it into a joke like it was funny so
that when I told the supervisor.’
 Deputy Administrator’s interview notes with Youth A, dated 01/06/21. Youth A
stated, ‘I was looking at his card and then he sacked my face and said, “What
you looking at motherfucker?” Youth A also said that he did not think Staff 1
was trying to hurt him, but he was embarrassed in front of his peers.
 Supervisor A’s interview notes. Youth A reported the incident to Supervisor A.
Supervisor A reviewed the video and noted the incident, then made a report
to the CA and Deputy Administrator. Staff 1 was moved to another unit to
separate him from Youth A pending an investigation. Supervisor A obtained
initial and written statements from Youth A, Staff 1, and Staff 2, and provided
them to the Deputy Administrator on 01/06/21.
 Overnight Report, 01/06/21, documenting Staff 1 was moved from the unit.
 Memo with subject: Written Notice of Allegations, to Staff 1, dated 01/12/21.
 Staff 1’s employee file was reviewed.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.10169 Discipline.
(1) A facility shall have and follow written policy and
procedure which stipulates that residents shall not be
subjected to any of the following:
(a) Corporal or cruel punishment.
6

ANALYSIS: The facility is in violation of the rule. It was reported consistently
and verified on video review that Staff 1 hit Youth A in the face
with the back of his hand. While this did not cause injury and did
not appear egregious, physical discipline is not permitted.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
I recommend that your CAP for the violation include your plans
to address this particular staff, as well as a review/revision of
your current policy on corporal punishment. You might consider
adding a subset or differentiation for employee actions assessed
as intended to cause pain/injury and those that are not. DCWL
considers all acts of physical discipline under corporal
punishment, regardless of the intention to cause pain/injury.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the findings of this investigation, I recommend no change to the current
license status. This recommendation is contingent on the facility providing an
acceptable and timely corrective action plan for the noted violation.
